planning_unit_name: Campaspe River at Reach 2
Objective: Maintain/Increase River Red Gum: To maintain adult River Red Gum trees and facilitate successful recruitment

planning_unit_name: Campaspe River at Reach 2
Objective: Increase native fish: To increase the population size, with an appropriate age structure of small and large bodied native fish known to occur in the Campaspe River. E.g. Golden Perch, Murray Cod and Murray Darling Rainbowfish

planning_unit_name: Campaspe River at Reach 2
Objective: Maintain/increase diversity and productivity of macroinvertebrates and macroinvertebrate functional feeding groups

planning_unit_name: Campaspe River at Reach 2
Objective: Increase extent/maintain emergent littoral macrophytes (e.g. Phragmites, rushes, reeds and sedges) on benches and edges of channel, but limit their encroachment into the middle of the channel

planning_unit_name: Campaspe River at Reach 2
Objective: Increase extent/maintain instream aquatic plants (e.g. Water Ribbons, Eel Grass)

planning_unit_name: Campaspe River at Reach 2
Objective: Control salinity and stratification in deep pools

planning_unit_name: Campaspe River at Reach 2
Objective: Facilitate recolonisation by native fish species that have been presumed lost e.g. Trout Cod, River Blackfish and Macquarie Perch.

planning_unit_name: Campaspe River at Reach 2
Objective: Platypus - Maintain/increase resident breeding population by facilitating successful recruitment at least every second year and promote safe dispersal by juveniles

planning_unit_name: Campaspe River at Reach 2
Objective: Maintain/Improve connectivity between the Campaspe River reaches and between the Campaspe River and the Murray River

planning_unit_name: Campaspe River at Reach 3
Objective: Maintain/Increase River Red Gum: To maintain adult River Red Gum trees and facilitate successful recruitment

Objective: Maintain/increase diversity and productivity of macroinvertebrates and macroinvertebrate functional feeding groups

planning_unit_name: Coliban River at Reach 1
Objective: Increase abundance and diversity of opportunistic small-bodied native fish such as Australian Smelt, Flatheaded Gudgeon and Mountain Galaxias.

planning_unit_name: Coliban River at Reach 1
Objective: Provide habitat and flow conditions that will allow River Blackfish to reestablish

planning_unit_name: Coliban River at Reach 1
Objective: Provide conditions that consistently support widespread successful breeding of Platypus to increase its resilience to future drought and floods and to provide surplus juveniles that can disperse to and colonise other suitable waterways

planning_unit_name: Coliban River at Reach 1
Objective: Maintain and increase cover and diversity of instream aquatics such as Triglochin procerum, Myriophyllum varrifolium and Potamogeton spp.

planning_unit_name: Coliban River at Reach 1
Objective: Maintain and increase abundance and diversity of emergent fringing vegetation such as Phragmites, Juncus and Bolboschoenus on benches and edges of channel, but limit their encroachment into the middle of the channel

planning_unit_name: Coliban River at Reach 1
Objective: Maintain adult riparian woody vegetation (e.g. River Red Gum, Callistemon sieberi, Leptospermum lanigerum, and Acacia provincialis) and facilitate recruitment

planning_unit_name: Coliban River at Reach 1
Objective: Maintain water quality that is able to support aquatic biota and ecological processes

planning_unit_name: Coliban River at Reach 1
Objective: Maintain and increase overall abundance, diversity and productivity of macroinvertebrates and macroinvertebrate functional feeding groups to drive productive and dynamic foodwebs.

planning_unit_name: Coliban River at Reach 1
Objective: Maintain channel form, replenish benches and scour pools to maintain their depth

planning_unit_name: Coliban River at Reach 1
Objective: Clean substrates including rocks, submerged wood and macrophytes

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Upper Loddon River System at Reach 1
Objective: To increase the population size, with an appropriate age structure, of native fish species in the impounded Loddon River System reaches

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Upper Loddon River System at Reach 1
Objective: Increase population size (with appropriate age structure) and distribution of River Blackfish and facilitate re-colonisation of Reach 1 via Laanecoorie Reservoir.

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Upper Loddon River System at Reach 1
Objective: Enhance natural recruitment and dispersal of stocked Murray Cod populations in disconnected impoundments e.g. Laanecoorie Reservoir, Serpentine Weir pool, Loddon Weir pool, and large pools between Laanecoorie Reservoir and Serpentine Creek (Durham Ox weir pool).

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Upper Loddon River System at Reach 1
Objective: Maintain habitat for stocked populations of Golden Perch in disconnected reaches e.g. Laanecoorie Reservoir, Serpentine Weir pool, Loddon Weir pool, and large pools between Laanecoorie Reservoir and Serpentine Creek

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Upper Loddon River System at Reach 1
Objective: Increase population size (with appropriate age structure) of small-bodied native fish species including Murray-Darling Rainbowfish, Flathead Gudgeon, Carp Gudgeon, and Australian Smelt.

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Upper Loddon River System at Reach 1
Objective: To increase the population size, with an appropriate age structure, and the diversity of native fish species, in the connected mid and lower Loddon River System

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Upper Loddon River System at Reach 1
Objective: Increase population size and diversity (with appropriate age structure) of small-bodied native fish species including Murray-Darling Rainbowfish, Flathead Gudgeon, Carp Gudgeon, and Australian Smelt.

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Upper Loddon River System at Reach 1
Objective: Enhance natural recruitment of Murray Cod population and allow fish to disperse and colonise suitable habitats in the Mid-Murray floodplain system.

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Upper Loddon River System at Reach 1
Objective: Extend available critical habitat to facilitate recolonisation of large bodied fish such as Silver Perch and Golden Perch populations in the Mid-Murray floodplain system

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Upper Loddon River System at Reach 1
Objective: Increase size of resident breeding Platypus populations and facilitate dispersal of surplus juveniles that can colonise other reaches of the Loddon River and connected catchments.

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Upper Loddon River System at Reach 1
Objective: Maintain adult riparian woody vegetation (e.g. River Red Gum, Black Box, Bottlebrush, Tea Tree, Melaleuca and Tangled Lignum – species composition will vary between reaches) and facilitate recruitment adjacent to the river channel and in low lying floodplain areas that are watered via floodrunners

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Upper Loddon River System at Reach 1
Objective: Maintain low lying floodplain vegetation communities. These communities are characterised by a River Red Gum overstorey and grassy, sedge or lignum understorey.

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Upper Loddon River System at Reach 1
Objective: Maintain and increase spatial extent of in-stream vegetation

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Upper Loddon River System at Reach 1
Objective: Increase diversity and appropriate spatial extent of native emergent fringing nonwoody vegetation along the banks and in floodrunners or anabranches.

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Upper Loddon River System at Reach 1
Objective: Maintain biofilm productivity, especially on coarse woody debris.

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Upper Loddon River System at Reach 1
Objective: Maintain/Increase aquatic biota such as Freshwater turtles, native frogs and water rats

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Upper Loddon River System at Reach 1
Objective: Maintain/increase diversity and productivity of macroinvertebrates and macroinvertebrate functional feeding groups to drive productive and dynamic foodwebs.

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Upper Loddon River System at Reach 1
Objective: Maintain water quality at a level that is able to support fish and macroinvertebrates. In particular maintain adequate concentrations of dissolved oxygen, prevent salinity levels rising above 3,000 EC and prevent excessive water temperatures during low flow periods.

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Upper Loddon River System at Reach 1
Objective: Re-establish deep pools in areas that have been affected by sand slugs, maintain existing pools in other areas and replenish benches within the channel.

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Upper Loddon River System at Reach 1
Objective: Flush accumulated silt and sediment from substrates including rocks, submerged wood and macrophytes

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Lower Loddon River at Reach 5
Objective: Re-establish deep pools in areas that have been affected by sand slugs, maintain existing pools in other areas and replenish benches within the channel.

planning_unit_name: Loddon River: Lower Loddon River at Reach 5
Objective: Flush accumulated silt and sediment from substrates including rocks, submerged wood and macrophytes

planning_unit_name: Pyramid Creek at Whole Creek
Objective: To increase the population size, with an appropriate age structure, of native fish species in the impounded Loddon River System reaches

planning_unit_name: Pyramid Creek at Whole Creek
Objective: Increase population size (with appropriate age structure) and distribution of River Blackfish and facilitate re-colonisation of Reach 1 via Laanecoorie Reservoir.

planning_unit_name: Pyramid Creek at Whole Creek
Objective: Enhance natural recruitment and dispersal of stocked Murray Cod populations in disconnected impoundments e.g. Laanecoorie Reservoir, Serpentine Weir pool, Loddon Weir pool, and large pools between Laanecoorie Reservoir and Serpentine Creek (Durham Ox weir pool).

planning_unit_name: Pyramid Creek at Whole Creek
Objective: Maintain habitat for stocked populations of Golden Perch in disconnected reaches e.g. Laanecoorie Reservoir, Serpentine Weir pool, Loddon Weir pool, and large pools between Laanecoorie Reservoir and Serpentine Creek

planning_unit_name: Pyramid Creek at Whole Creek
Objective: Increase population size (with appropriate age structure) of small-bodied native fish species including Murray-Darling Rainbowfish, Flathead Gudgeon, Carp Gudgeon, and Australian Smelt.

planning_unit_name: Pyramid Creek at Whole Creek
Objective: To increase the population size, with an appropriate age structure, and the diversity of native fish species, in the connected mid and lower Loddon River System

planning_unit_name: Pyramid Creek at Whole Creek
Objective: Increase population size and diversity (with appropriate age structure) of small-bodied native fish species including Murray-Darling Rainbowfish, Flathead Gudgeon, Carp Gudgeon, and Australian Smelt.

planning_unit_name: Pyramid Creek at Whole Creek
Objective: Enhance natural recruitment of Murray Cod population and allow fish to disperse and colonise suitable habitats in the Mid-Murray floodplain system.

planning_unit_name: Pyramid Creek at Whole Creek
Objective: Extend available critical habitat to facilitate recolonisation of large bodied fish such as Silver Perch and Golden Perch populations in the Mid-Murray floodplain system

planning_unit_name: Pyramid Creek at Whole Creek
Objective: Increase size of resident breeding Platypus populations and facilitate dispersal of surplus juveniles that can colonise other reaches of the Loddon River and connected catchments.

planning_unit_name: Pyramid Creek at Whole Creek
Objective: Maintain adult riparian woody vegetation (e.g. River Red Gum, Black Box, Bottlebrush, Tea Tree, Melaleuca and Tangled Lignum – species composition will vary between reaches) and facilitate recruitment adjacent to the river channel and in low lying floodplain areas that are watered via floodrunners

planning_unit_name: Pyramid Creek at Whole Creek
Objective: Maintain low lying floodplain vegetation communities. These communities are characterised by a River Red Gum overstorey and grassy, sedge or lignum understorey.

planning_unit_name: Pyramid Creek at Whole Creek
Objective: Maintain and increase spatial extent of in-stream vegetation

planning_unit_name: Pyramid Creek at Whole Creek
Objective: Increase diversity and appropriate spatial extent of native emergent fringing nonwoody vegetation along the banks and in floodrunners or anabranches.

planning_unit_name: Pyramid Creek at Whole Creek
Objective: Maintain biofilm productivity, especially on coarse woody debris.

planning_unit_name: Pyramid Creek at Whole Creek
Objective: Maintain/Increase aquatic biota such as Freshwater turtles, native frogs and water rats

planning_unit_name: Pyramid Creek at Whole Creek
Objective: Maintain/increase diversity and productivity of macroinvertebrates and macroinvertebrate functional feeding groups to drive productive and dynamic foodwebs.

planning_unit_name: Pyramid Creek at Whole Creek
Objective: Maintain water quality at a level that is able to support fish and macroinvertebrates. In particular maintain adequate concentrations of dissolved oxygen, prevent salinity levels rising above 3,000 EC and prevent excessive water temperatures during low flow periods.

planning_unit_name: Pyramid Creek at Whole Creek
Objective: Re-establish deep pools in areas that have been affected by sand slugs, maintain existing pools in other areas and replenish benches within the channel.

planning_unit_name: Pyramid Creek at Whole Creek
Objective: Flush accumulated silt and sediment from substrates including rocks, submerged wood and macrophytes

planning_unit_name: Birchs Creek Reach 1
Objective: Increase abundance and diversity of native fish such as River Blackfish, Mountain Galaxias, Flatheaded Gudgeon and Australian Smelt

planning_unit_name: Birchs Creek Reach 1
Objective: Provide conditions that consistently support widespread successful breeding by Platypus to increase population resilience to future drought and floods and to provide surplus juveniles that can disperse to Creswick Creek and Tullaroop Creek

planning_unit_name: Birchs Creek Reach 1
Objective: Maintain and increase overall abundance, diversity and productivity of macroinvertebrates and macroinvertebrate functional feeding groups to drive productive and dynamic food webs

planning_unit_name: Birchs Creek Reach 1
Objective: Provide habitat and flow conditions that will allow River Blackfish to re-establish in Reaches 1 & 2

planning_unit_name: Birchs Creek Reach 1
Objective: Maintain water quality that is able to support aquatic biota and ecological processes

planning_unit_name: Birchs Creek Reach 1
Objective: Maintain (Reach 3) and improve (Reaches 1 & 2) diversity and abundance of instream aquatics

planning_unit_name: Birchs Creek Reach 1
Objective: Reduce dominance of exotic instream aquatics such as Elodea (especially in Reaches 1 and 2)

planning_unit_name: Birchs Creek Reach 1
Objective: Maintain and improve abundance and diversity of emergent fringing vegetation

planning_unit_name: Birchs Creek Reach 1
Objective: Maintain (Reach 3) and restore (Reaches 1 & 2) adult riparian woody vegetation (e.g. Swamp Gum, Manna Gum, River Red Gum) and facilitate recruitment.

Objective: Maintain (Reach 3) and restore (Reaches 1 & 2) adult riparian woody vegetation (e.g. Swamp Gum, Manna Gum, River Red Gum) and facilitate recruitment.
